Posts.Content: I have some question about this subject, I would like to ask my sisters in pink, my fellow warriors. But I am not sure if it is appropriate here? God, I hate having to even ask that! Love you all...Alison I am very nervous as I point my mouse and hit...submit
Posts.Title: Medical MJ

Posts.Content: Sometimes, some of us, think somethings amiss, when someone comes on all of a sudden with no background, and the skeptical think "Who are you?" You do seem to be legit. and not some kind of spammer, many personal issues are shared here, anyway you'll figure it out, welcome!! Alison
Posts.Title: Disneyfan2008

Posts.Content: Get yourself some antianxiety meds.,they help, and try to be gratefull! Life is precious and way to short, no matter how long you live. God bless and hugs to you..Alison I went through much of the same, as have many here. It'll be alright!
Posts.Title: Mastectomy is my only option

Posts.Content: I had almost exactly the same problem. I underwent bilateral mastectomy last June. I had the drains in forever (8 weeks more or less). Then after they were removed I had fluid build up again, primarily on the unaffected side. I also had no node invovement. I had to be drained all through chemo on a regular basis. I absolutely hated that feeling of the fluid when it is rollin around in your chest. My plastic surgeon suggested reconstruction might resolve the problem and I had a tram-flap recon. in Dec.. I have not had any problem since. Be patient, know you are not alone, your body is just trying to figure out how to respond to everything you have been through. God Bless you, Alison
Posts.Title: Can't seem to get rid of the Drains!

Posts.Content: My hands and fingers are not as strong and sometimes I am very clumsy. I have notice it is worst when I am tired. I just ask for help when I can't do something like open a jar and my manly hubby take over the task. My eye sight was also significantly affected by treatment. God bless..Alison
Posts.Title: finger weakness has any one have it?

Posts.Content: Hi Mama G, I am so happy to hear your treatment was OK. It means so much that it was painfree. Are you expecting side effects? What if you know? Hug to you...alison
Posts.Title: Cyberknife was a BREEZE!!

Posts.Content: I pray for peace and comfort for you, Lesley, and your girls. May God hold you all tight in his loving arms and comfort you during this most difficult time! God Bless...Alison
Posts.Title: Lesley is home

Posts.Content: I also, have thought, what a lovely photo! You are beautiful!
Posts.Title: During a chat with the National Cancer Institute....

Posts.Content: My onc. told me that lumpctomy does not increase the chance for reoccurence any more than mastectomy. It's about getting the cancer/tumor out(surgery)before it starts shedding cells and then doing the adjuvent treatments depending on your cancer. It's all very complicated and hard to process when your right in the middle of it all. I think your idea of talking to a professional is a good one. I had bilat. mast. June 09 then did months of chemo,and found some counseing to be VERY helpfull. My counselor specialized in people with cancer, transplant patients, ect. and she really helped me see that my life is truly worth the fight. God bless you and I'll keep you in my prayers! Hugs...Alison
Posts.Title: Is there a chance of reoccurence after double mast.?

Posts.Content: That's why eveyone wants to dance with NED! (no eviedence of disease)
Posts.Title: whats NED mean?

Posts.Content: That is just not right, and you must surely be upset! I can't offer advice, but I would keep looking into it. Did you ask your insurance directly? Maybe going through a physician referel would change the decision, I'd try telling em I want the affected breast enhanced, just to make a point! I'm sure others here will have better comments. Hugs..alison

Posts.Content: Please know many prayers are being said on you and your families behalf, I am so sorry you have to go through all this right now, all at once. Just try and remember "this to shall pass" Love, hugs, and prayer heading your way...love alison
Posts.Title: First Mom then Dad

Posts.Content: Have a wonderful visit with your new granddaughter! I can not wait till it's my turn, to look into a cute little baby face and know I'm the grandma!! How fun!
Posts.Title: Non bc celebration :-)

Posts.Content: I am a tnbc and currently dancing with NED. I know nothing about Avastin. I am going to go to the site you indicated now. I am not quite a year out of treatment and sometime I think, "Isn't there anything I can be given to decrease my odds of reoccurence". I was dxed at 51, had bilat mast, 4 rounds ac and 4 taxol. Now I see my onc every 3 months and will I have an appt. Thank you again for the valuable infor. God bless alison
